newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Commission moves to reform social dialogue.
newsitem.headline: Commission moves to reform social dialogue.

text.p: The European Commission adopted a communication on Wednesday opening consultations with the social partners on how to improve the social dialogue.

"The suggestions for reform in this communication are aimed at a rationalisation of structures and an optimal allocation of the resources available," Social Affairs Commissioner Padraig Flynn was quoted as saying in a statement.
The paper, the Commission said in a statement, was aimed at adapting the social dialogue to the major policy changes facing the European Union.
The Commission is seeking views by the end of the year, after which it will submit a second communication in 1997.
